title: Sam Faiers leaves the Pride Of Britain Awards holding hands with Paul Knightley
text:
Sam Faiers and Paul Knightley appeared in high spirits as they left the Pride Of Britain Awards held at The Grosvenor Hotel in London on Monday.

Paul, 31, took Sam's hand as he led her back to their awaiting taxi after the glitzy ceremony.

The Mummy Diaries star, 28, looked effortlessly glamorous in her strapless Tom Ford black velvet gown.

Loved-up: Sam Faiers and Paul Knightley appeared in high spirits as they left the Pride Of Britain Awards held at The Grosvenor Hotel in London on Monday

The couple mingled with a slew of reality stars and television personalities and appeared to have relished time off from parenting duties to attend the swanky soirée.

Sam later shared a loved-up Instagram snap of herself and Paul in the back of the taxi and captioned the photo with a simple heart emoji.

The former TOWIE star had certainly pulled out all of the stops for her red carpet appearance in the stunning strapless floor-length dress.

Gentleman: Paul, 31, took Sam's hand as he led her back to their awaiting taxi after the glitzy ceremony

Drop-dead gorgeous: The Mummy Diaries star, 28, looked effortlessly glamorous in her strapless Tom Ford black velvet gown as she left the hotel

Happy: The couple mingled with a slew of reality stars and television personalities and appeared to have relished time off from parenting duties to attend the swanky soirée

Date night: Sam later shared a loved-up Instagram snap of herself and Paul in the back of the taxi and captioned the photo with a simple heart emoji

The black gown featured a skin-baring panel down her midriff with silk bow detailing joining the two sides, which highlighted her incredible figure to perfection.

The mother-of-two styled her glamorous look with a pair of towering black strappy heels, while carrying her essentials in a bejewelled clutch bag in hues of green and gold.

She swept her golden locks up into chic up do, while accentuating her natural beauty with an expertly applied coat of make-up including a shimmering smokey-eye and slick of nude lipstick.

Yummy mummy: The former TOWIE star had certainly pulled out all of the stops for her red carpet appearance in the stunning strapless floor-length dress

Stunning: She accessorised the look with a black velvet choker and diamond earrings

Wow: The form-fitting style of the floor-length gown highlighted her sizzling frame to perfection as she posed for snaps

Sam attended the event with her long-term boyfriend Paul, who looked dapper in a navy suit.

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars came together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognised and celebrated ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor honoured this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Glamorous: Sam looked stunning in her black gown which featured a skin-baring panel down her midriff with silk bow detailing joining the two sides

Elegant: The mother-of-two styled her glamorous look with a pair of towering black strappy heels, while carrying her essentials in a bejewelled clutch bag in hues of green and gold

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

Sam's glam night out comes shortly after she and sister Billie declared during the final episode of The Mummy Diaries that they are considering having another child.

As the episode drew to a close, the siblings teased what could be in store for them when the show returns in 2020.

Reflecting on the ups and downs of 2019, the pair declared even though their partners Paul and Greg Shepherd aren't enthralled by the prospect, it could be time next year for 'baby number three'.

Both are parents to a son and daughter each: Billie shares Nelly, five, and Arthur, two, with Greg, while Sam has Paul, three, and Rosie, who turns two next month.
description: Sam Faiers and Paul Knightley appeared in high spirits as they left the Pride Of Britain Awards hand-in-hand on Monday.
